intro: Lycianthes testacea, commonly known as the scarlet globe flower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and eggplants. The plant is characterized by its striking red, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its fruits are small, spherical berries that turn red when mature.
